item.title: Zombies, Run! isn‚Äôt headed for the grave after all
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this year, it looked like time was up for ZRX: Zombies, Run!, a popular fitness app that mixed couch-to-5K plans with postapocalyptic audio storytelling. Now, cocreator and author Naomi Alderman has announced that she‚Äôs bought back the franchise from the brink.

Zombies, Run! was first founded in 2012 with about 10 million users worldwide. The app, made by Six to Start, immerses runners and walkers in an episode-based storyline where the undead ‚Äúchase‚Äù users. Despite the expensive and time-intensive process, the company was successful enough to make other immersive fitness games, including Marvel Move. Six to Start was bought by OliveX in 2021.

In March 2025, OliveX laid off all but two Six to Start staff members, noting that the game would be shut down if a buyer could not be found. At the time, sources told The Verge that the Six to Start staff clashed with OliveX and its owner, Animoca Brands, over the games‚Äô anticapitalist themes and the latter‚Äôs attempts to create crypto and NFT projects. Later, Six to Start alerted users that the Zombies, Run! app, archive, and message boards would remain available, but that future episodes were paused, leaving the app‚Äôs future in limbo.

‚ÄúI am incredibly delighted to be taking ownership of the game. This isn‚Äôt a big corporate takeover, it‚Äôs me buying back the game I made and love so I can look after it,‚Äù Alderman wrote in a post on the Zombies, Run! website. Alderman also confirmed the news in a Bluesky post.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre working on a new story for Zombies, Run!, which I‚Äôm intending to be a great ‚Äòon-ramp‚Äô for new players or people who want to come back to the game after a break,‚Äù Alderman tells The Verge. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll also resume production on Season 11, which was paused halfway through ‚Äî a very long cliffhanger to wait through!‚Äù

Alderman clarified that she hasn‚Äôt bought Six to Start. Rather, she‚Äôs bought the Zombies, Run! franchise, along with The Walk ‚Äî another immersive fitness game Alderman created with Six to Start. She also confirmed that Marvel Move had already been in the process of sunsetting, but that the app will be supported until the last annual subscription ends in July next year.

Alderman says that her main focus going forward will be preserving the app and experience, noting that she‚Äôll be reaching out to the community soon with more news. ‚ÄúZombies, Run! has been a community effort since the first Kickstarter, and we‚Äôll keep it shambling on together.‚Äù

Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed and to receive email updates.

  • Victoria Song

item.title: Rockstar fired unionising GTA 6 devs following Discord chat about new company Slack policy, claims report
item.content:encoded:
IWGB Union boss accuses company of "trying to govern by fear"

A new report claims the firing of 34 developers by Rockstar Games for alleged "gross misconduct" followed a Discord discussion which cited emails about changes to the company's internal Slack policies. Rockstar have been accused of union busting by the Independent Workers' Union of Great Britain over the firings, with the union having filed legal claims against the company.

This new report from People Make Games cites an anonymous Rockstar insider as having passed on messages from the private Discord server Rockstar developers and IWGB staff were using to organise, with the insider claiming they believe these messages contributed to the firings. The alleged messages in question discuss and include snippets of text from internal Rockstar emails concerning a change in internal Slack policy, which the company reportedly announced to staff in the second week of October this year.

According to People Make Games, the policy changes included the removal of miscellaneous Slack channels which staff used for non-work related discussions, with Rockstar allegedly claiming these had become distracting and occasionally sources of poor conduct. The report claims that at least one of the two emails from Rockstar about the changes was sent out after 5PM UK time, with Rockstar staff reportedly only able to access their work emails while at the company office during work hours. Some members of the Discord who were still in office then allegedly shared information or quotes from the emails in the server, so staff who'd gone home could see and discuss them.

People Make Games claim Rockstar management then became aware of these messages when at least one non-union member of the Discord server reached out to them to express concern.

I've reached out to Rockstar for comment.

Asked about the Discord discussion of the Slack policy changes by People Make Games, IWGB union president Alex Marshall said the following:

I think it is absolutely normal for people to be discussing their material conditions, whether that's bonuses, whether that's policies, whether that's anything like that. That's completely normal for staff to be doing that and for an employer to respond in a way that comes down so hard on that shows not only that they are governing by this lack of transparency, but they're also trying to govern by fear. They feel completely threatened by the idea of workers talking to each other and that's why they've taken this act to try and destroy the union, decimate any form of kind of solidarity being built between workers.

Earlier this month, Liberal Democrat MP Christine Jardine raised the issue of the firings in UK Parliament, revealing that she'd written to Rockstar asking for information about the issue and requesting a meeting with a relevant minister in the hopes of discussing what support may be offered to affected staff.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/rockstar-fired-unionising-gta-6-devs-following-discord-chat-about-new-company-slack-policy-claims-report

That does leave out one very important and all-too-often ignored part of a truly pro-quality recording ‚Äî the sound. Even the best smartphones and pocket-sized action cams can leave you with truly spectacular video paired with tinny, shallow sound filled with background noise.

There‚Äôs no need for a boom mic ‚Äî the DJI Mic Mini wireless lavalier microphone transmitter is the tiny, ultra-lightweight (10 grams) solution that delivers exceptional sound from as far away as 400 meters. Content creators, vloggers, and travel buffs can give their content a massive upgrade for a lowest-ever price during this Amazon Black Friday blowout that drops the price of the DJI Mic Mini by 45%, down to just $66.

Pro-Level Sound for Pro-Level Content

As 4K or even higher-resolution video has moved from being the exclusive property of professional videographers to being a smartphone feature that you carry in your pocket, the world of content creation has exploded. But with ultra-hi-res videos and vlogs being created by virtually anyone and everyone, the best way to set yourself apart from the masses is with content that pairs that video with sound that‚Äôs just as good. DJI has mastered ultra-high-quality cameras, both in their tiny action cameras and their famous fleet of consumer drones. Once they turned their attention to sound, it was no surprise that the result was exceptionally small and lightweight, highly versatile, and of the best quality.

In barely a year‚Äôs time the Mic Mini has become the gold standard of rechargeable wireless microphones, with a stellar 4.7-star average rating at Amazon. It can be worn as a clip-on, on a lanyard, or magnetically attached to your clothes ‚Äî regardless of how you decide to go, it‚Äôs unobtrusive on camera and able to deliver a highly stable, impeccable sound transmission from as far away as 400 meters, even in busy or noisy environments. Two built-in levels of noise cancellation ‚Äî Basic for quiet indoor settings and Strong for noisy environments or outdoor shoots ‚Äî cut out the background noise, often the biggest shortfall of video shot on a smartphone.

The Total Package

The sound quality of the DJI Mini Mic sets it apart from the built-in mics of any consumer-level video device ‚Äî 48Hz sampling and 120 decibels of full, clear, rich sound. This Amazon deal includes everything you need to give your videos a huge sound boost ‚Äì two transmitters and one receiver, a USB-C charging cable, four mini windscreens, a type-C smartphone adapter, two DJI Mic Mini Clip magnets, and a carrying pouch.

If you‚Äôre already shooting video with a DJI Osmo camera ‚Äî the Pocket 3, Action 4, or Action 5 Pro, the Mini Mic can be used in a direct wireless connection to the camera, delivering premium audio without the need for a receiver. And a single charge gives you 48 hours of shoot time, so you never have to worry about going silent in the middle of a shoot.

For anyone who wants their videos to sound as good or even better than they look, this is the best $66 upgrade you can make. It‚Äôs an amazing pre-Black Friday deal that‚Äôs live right now at Amazon ‚Äî 45% off the price of the DJI Mic Mini.

item.title: LEGO Millennium Falcon Stays Full Price on Official Site, But Selling for Pennies on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
LEGO‚Äôs official website lists flagship sets at full retail price year-round with very little pricing variations. Amazon manages its own inventory and slashed the prices of thousands of products aggressively on Black Friday. Indeed, while LEGO still sells the Star Wars Millennium Falcon (25th anniversary) set for $84 on its website, Amazon slashes it to $67. This 921-piece collectible build of one of the most iconic starships in cinematic history is now at its lowest price ever.

See at Amazon

Our Favorite Star Wars Set

The 921-piece construction is satisfying to build and requires several sessions of focused building time. Each bag of parts opens up a new section of the Falcon, from the detailed cockpit to the iconic sensor dish. The process of building naturally encourages mindful relaxation as you work your way through the instructions, never hurrying the pace.

The mid-scale size hits the sweet spot between desktop models and massive display pieces: At 9.5 inches long, 7.5 inches wide, and 5 inches high, the finished Falcon commands attention without dominating an entire shelf. The proportions of this LEGO version hold true to the ship from A New Hope and do so in a structurally safe way. You can place this next to other mid-scale starships from the LEGO Star Wars collection with no mismatched sizes. The dimensions are perfect for home office desks, bedroom shelves, or living room displays.

Authentic details recreate the Falcon‚Äôs most recognizable features in LEGO brick form: The cockpit sits offset on the starboard side, just as it should. The quad laser cannons rotate and articulate for different display poses. The sensor dish mounts on top in its classic pre-Return of the Jedi configuration. The hull greebling makes use of clever part combinations to suggest the weathered, lived-in aesthetic of the original prop.

Thoughtful presentation features on the display stand take this set from toy to d√©cor piece. Instead of placing flat on the table, the angled mounting provides dynamic visual interest. The nameplate clearly identifies the ship for guests who might not be too familiar with Star Wars. There is also a brick that commemorates 25 years of LEGO‚Äôs partnership with Star Wars. This stand design shows LEGO understands their adult audience, wanting display-worthy builds rather than play sets.

4.9 out of 5 stars, with almost 2,000 reviews, confirms this set lives up to expectations. More than 10,000 sold in the last month prove sustained popularity well beyond a niche following among Star Wars fans. The wide appeal crosses multiple demographics: long-time fans of the franchise, LEGO collectors, d√©cor-conscious adults, and gift-givers seeking a well-appreciated gift. The universal recognition of the Millennium Falcon transcends typical hobby boundaries.

At $67, the Star Wars Millennium Falcon set offers collectible quality 20% off retail this Black Friday. LEGO‚Äôs official site is still charging full price, while Amazon moves inventory aggressively.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1620: Hints and Answer for November 25, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1620 for November 25, 2025.

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you‚Äôve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 25, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1620 should be pretty easy for most players. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 4 of 6 guesses. That makes the exact same as the 4-guess average from November 24.

General Wordle Hints For November 25

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word contains two different vowels.
  • Hint 2: If you rearrange its letters, you can form a commonly used mode of transportation.
  • Hint 3: The word follows a consonant-heavy pattern with only two vowel positions.
  • Hint 4: Swapping its first two letters creates another valid English word.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1620 for November 25, 2025

Starter Words For November 25, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • APPLE
  • PEDAL
  • PLEAT

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1620 On November 25, 2025

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: PLEAD

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer Mean?

Plead is a verb that means ‚Äúto appeal or entreat earnestly‚Äù. It can also me ‚Äúto use arguments or persuasions, as with a person, for or against something‚Äù.

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1619 on November 24, 2025:

Answer: DOUGH

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1620?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 26 will be Wordle Game #1621.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Devs Talk About Next Game
item.content:encoded:
Arrowhead Game Studios recently spoke about their next title, revealing that it shouldn‚Äôt be too far from Helldivers.

We have been hearing a lot about Helldivers 2 recently, with the developers also commenting on a Switch 2 port. However, we have yet to hear new details about the next game that Arrowhead Game Studios has been working on. The latest comments from the devs don‚Äôt provide too much information, but should be enough to make Helldivers fans happy.

Arrowhead Studios‚Äô Next Game Will Not Be ‚ÄòToo Far‚Äô from Helldivers

During a new interview with GamesRadar+, Arrowhead Game Studios CCO, Johan Pilestedt, spoke a bit about their next title. Pilestedt first revealed that the game is currently in his favorite phase, the part he loves the most. The CCO revealed that he loves getting a new team together, breaking down boundaries among themselves, and getting to the heart of ‚Äúwho we are as people, and what games do we want to make together.‚Äù

Talking about what Arrowhead devs want to make, Pilestedt states that the team is ‚Äúlooking to continue the legacy of what we‚Äôve created already.‚Äù The CCO added that the next title is ‚Äúsomething that‚Äôs too far off from Helldivers‚Äù, which means that people who are massive Helldivers fans will be able to jump into their next game and ‚Äúrecognise the DNA‚Äù they have become familiar with over the years. The devs didn‚Äôt provide any more details about the game or explain how Helldivers will inspire it.

In other news, Helldivers 2‚Äôs Xbox port helped increase the sales and engagement for PS5 and PC versions. Additionally, here‚Äôs what the devs said about the installation size and load times. item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Arcade-style beat 'em up game due out on December 1.

Publisher Dotemu and developer Tribute Games have released the opening animation for arcade-style beat ‚Äôem up game MARVEL Cosmic Invasion.

Here is an overview of the game, via Dotemu:

In MARVEL Cosmic Invasion, the immortal Super Villain Annihilus has launched an unprecedented attack across the galaxy, threatening all life as we know it. Fighters, both Earth-born and cosmic, must now join forces in a star-spanning adventure against the deadly Annihilation Wave. Choosing from a unique roster of characters, brawl through the streets of New York City all the way to the depths of the Negative Zone to foil Annihilus‚Äô vow to spread death across the cosmos with the help of Thanos, M.O.D.O.K, Taskmaster and more devious allies.

Defend the cosmos with a 15-hero playable roster, fighting as Captain America, She-Hulk, Rocket Racoon, Wolverine, Spider-Man, Storm, Phyla-Vell, Venom, Nova, Black Panther, Beta Ray Bill, Cosmic Ghost Rider, Silver Surfer, Phoenix or Invincible Iron Man. MARVEL Cosmic Invasion gives players an incredible variety of skills and styles to mix and match as they traverse across the cosmos in a star-spanning adventure.

Choose and control your own team of two characters while tagging between them mid-fight with the innovative Cosmic Swap system, capitalizing on distinct superpowers and special attacks to create unique team-ups and dish out devastating damage.

Unlock stellar powerups and rewards while experimenting with different duos and bash through a fantastic collection of locales and nemeses from the MARVEL universe. MARVEL Cosmic Invasion‚Äòs action includes a range of accessibility features, empowering the whole family to be Super Heroes (or Villains) and supports four player drop-in/drop-out local and online co-op with crossplay.

After setting the bar for arcade-inspired beat ‚Äôem ups with the acclaimed, multimillion-selling smash hit Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder‚Äôs Revenge, Dotemu and Tribute Games modernize the timeless fun of brawlers with exciting tag-team fighting and a multi-era celebration of the most iconic comic book universe. MARVEL Cosmic Invasion embodies the spirit of classic MARVEL character designs and delivers thrilling action that‚Äôd look right at home in an arcade cabinet.

MARVEL Cosmic Invasion is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on December 1.

Watch the opening animation below.
